intro: Crepinia istriaca, commonly known as the Istrian crepe jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Adriatic Sea, particularly in Croatia and Italy. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and early summer. Its flowers have a subtle fragrance and are often used in traditional herbal remedies. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal climates with mild winters and warm summers.
